message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
StudentObj getStudentInfo() {
    List<StudentObj> stObj = StudentDAO.getRows();
    Iterator<StudentObj> iterator = stObj.iterator();
    if (iterator.hasNext()) {
        return iterator.next();
    }
    return null;
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use an Iterator to go through your list of StudentObj. The Iterator's next method will return the next StudentObj in your list each time it's called. This way, each call to getStudentInfo will return the next student in the list. However, please note that this will not work if you have multiple threads calling getStudentInfo at the same time, as they will all share the same iterator. If you need to support multiple threads, you will need to implement some form of synchronization.
